alert.note: Alert for Broome; Delaware; Otsego; Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 12:10PM EST until February 19 at 1:15PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Otsego County in central New York... Southeastern Broome County in central New York... Delaware County in central New York... Northwestern Sullivan County in central New York... Susquehanna County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northern Wayne County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 115 PM EST. * At 1210 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Meridale to near Mehoopany, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Locations impacted include... Rockland, Damascus, Jackson, Walton, Delhi, Callicoon, Roxbury, Clifford, Sanford and Colchester. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 81 and 97. Interstate 88 between 11 and 12. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 206 and 223. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
